Package simulation.montecarlo

Class FieldTable

java.lang.Object
simulation.montecarlo.FieldTable
public final class FieldTable extends Object
Holds a table of precalculated values and performs interpolation to get requested values. Used to hold energy and magnetic moment of a Ho ion under different (Bx,By,Bz)

  • Field Details

    • table

      private final double[][][] table
      The data itself (magnetic moment or energy)

    • values

      private final double[][] values
      The applied magnetic field values

    • transposedRequiresMinus

      private final boolean transposedRequiresMinus
      Whether when getting a value for spin down, which requires transposing the table as in Bz->-Bz, should the result also have an additional minus sign (see comment in code)

    • name

      private final String name
      The name of the object, which is also the name of the file to read the data from

    • dj

      private final int[] dj
      Holds the min distance to determine whether consecutive calls are sufficiently correlated such that it is more efficient to hunt for the next value close to the previous one. See section 3.1.1 Search with Correlated Values in Numerical Recipes, 3rd edition.
      See Also:
      hunt(double, double[], int), binarySearch(double, double[])

  • Constructor Details

    • FieldTable

      private FieldTable​(double[][][] table, double[][] values, boolean transposedRequiresMinus0, String name)
      FieldTable constructor
      Parameters:
      table - - 3D double array of the values (usually read from a file by of(String, boolean)
      values - - 2D double array (must be 3 by N) representing the B values (Bx,By,Bz)
      transposedRequiresMinus0 - when calculating the magnetic moment of a down-spin, one can calculate the magnetic moment of an up-spin in with Bz->-Bz, but the result requires a minus sign. Hence for a FieldTable that contains magnetic moments, transposedRequiresMinus should be true, and for a FieldTable that contains energies it should be false.
      name - Name of this FieldTable. Options are "magnetic_moment_up_arr" and "energy_up_arr" to be consistent with the python script previously used.

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static FieldTable of​(String fileName, boolean transposedRequiresMinus)
      Reads the energy_arr/magnetic_moment_arr file into a table of double and return a FieldTable object
      Parameters:
      fileName - - name of table file to be read (without .txt extension)
      transposedRequiresMinus - Whether when getting a value for spin down, which requires transposing the table as in Bz->-Bz, should the result also have an additional minus sign (see comment in code)
      Returns:
      FieldTable object that has a table of average energy drop or magnetic moment due to different combinations of local fields (Bx,By,Bz) and also the Bx,By,Bz values themselves
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the FieldTable was not read from file for any reason.

    • getTableRange

      public double[] getTableRange​(int axis)
      Get the range covered by the table along some axis
      Parameters:
      axis - - the axis along which the range covered by the table is needed
      Returns:
      a size-2 array of the {min,max} values covered by the table

    • bilinearInterpolation

      public static double bilinearInterpolation​(double x1, double x2, double x, double y1, double y2, double y, double Q11, double Q12, double Q21, double Q22)
      Bilinear interpolation. see picture at http://supercomputingblog.com/graphics/coding-bilinear-interpolation/
      Parameters:
      x1 - - lower grid x value
      x2 - - higher grid x value
      x - - requested x value
      y1 - - lower grid y value
      y2 - - higher grid y value
      y - - requested y value
      Q11 - - function value at (x1,y1)
      Q12 - - function value at (x1,y2)
      Q21 - - function value at (x2,y1)
      Q22 - - function value at (x2,y2)
      Returns:
      Intermediate value withing square based on the values at the corners

    • trilinearInterpolation

      public static double trilinearInterpolation​(double x1, double x2, double x, double y1, double y2, double y, double z1, double z2, double z, double Q111, double Q121, double Q211, double Q221, double Q112, double Q122, double Q212, double Q222)
      Trilinear interpolation. Simply performs linear interpolation between 2 values obtained with bilinearInterpolation(double, double, double, double, double, double, double, double, double, double)
      Parameters:
      x1 - ,y1,z1 - lower grind values
      x2 - ,y2,z3 - higher grid values
      x - ,y,z - requested values
      Q111 - ,Q121,Q211,Q221,Q112,Q122,Q212,Q222 - function values at 8 corners of the grid box. Qijk is the function value at (xi,yj,zk).
      Returns:
      Intermediate value withing cube based on the values at the corners

    • binarySearch

      public static int[] binarySearch​(double value, double[] a)
      Binary search. Returns indices of the 2 closest values in a length-2 array: {lower,higher} If the value is outside the bounds of the table a, returns null
      Parameters:
      value - value to find
      a - array in which to find the value
      Returns:
      Indices of the 2 closest values in a length-2 array: {lower,higher}, or null if the value is outside the bounds of the received table.
      See Also:
      hunt(double, double[], int)

    • hunt

      public static int[] hunt​(double value, double[] a, int startIndex)
      Given a value, and an array, a, return an array int[]{high, low} such that value is between a[low] and a[high]. Alternative to binarySearch that looks near the received startIndex. Useful when subsequent calls should have similar values.
      Parameters:
      value - value to find
      a - array in which to find the value
      startIndex - index from which the search sould start
      Returns:
      Indices of the 2 closest values in a length-2 array: {lower,higher}, or null if the value is outside the bounds of the received table.
      See Also:
      binarySearch(double, double[])

    • pythonCalcValue

      @Deprecated public static double pythonCalcValue​(double Bx, double By, double Bz, String name)
      Deprecated.

    • manualCalcValue

      public static double manualCalcValue​(double Bx, double By, double Bz, boolean magneticMoment)
      manually (build and diagonalize the hamiltonian) calculate the magnetic moment or the eigenenergy (of a spin up)
      Parameters:
      Bx - Bx field
      By - By field
      Bz - Bz field
      magneticMoment - if true, calculate the magnetic moment. if false, calculate the eigenenergy.
      Returns:
      Eigenenergy or magnetic moment of a Ho ion under the received magnetic field and crystal field potential.

    • searchForIndices

      public int[][] searchForIndices​(double bx, double by, double bz, int[][] prevBIndices)
      Looks for the indices of the received Bx, By and Bz. Uses either hunt(double, double[], int) or binarySearch(double, double[]) depending on the received indicator.
      Parameters:
      bx - Bx field
      by - By field
      bz - Bz field
      prevBIndices -
      Returns:
      3 by 2 int array of closest indices to the received point. The formatting is: {{Bz_below, Bz_above}, {By_below, By_above}, {Bx_below, Bx_above}}

    • findInTable

      public double findInTable​(double bx, double by, double bz, int[][] prevBIndices) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      The main function that retrieves values from the table. Given Bx, By and Bz, returns the interpolated value. Also if prevBIndices is received, updates its elements to the closest indices of this search.
      Parameters:
      bx - Bx value
      by - By value
      bz - Bz value
      prevBIndices - - 2D Array. The first row contains the (lower) indices where the previous field was found. Could be useful if the current search is expected to be close to that. Could be null, and then full binary-search is performed. The second row contains 1 if the last searches were deemed correlated and 0 otherwise.
      Returns:
      Interpolated value
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the received bx, by or bz are outside the bounds of the table.

    • getDerivative

      public double getDerivative​(int diff_by, double[] b_I, double s, int[][] prevBIndices)
      Get the partial derivative of the (linear) interpolated function. diff_by = 0,1,2 which means partial differentiation by z,y,x.
      Parameters:
      diff_by - Partial differentiation by 0,1,2 which means by z,y,x. (in this order)
      b_I - Array of the magnetic field at which the partial derivative should be performed. format is {bz,by,bx}
      s - spin
      prevBIndices - same as in findInTable(double, double, double, int[][])
      Returns:
      partial derivative of the (linear) interpolated function at point b_I.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the received bx, by or bz are outside the bounds of the table.

    • booleanToInt

      public static int booleanToInt​(boolean value)
      Convert true to 1 and false to 0.
      Parameters:
      value - value to be converted
      Returns:
      1 if value is true and 0 if value is false

    • getValue

      public returnDoubleAndStatus getValue​(double bx, double by, double bz, double s, boolean returnSuccessStatus, int[][] prevBIndices)
      get value from this table (by interpolation)
      Parameters:
      bx - Bx field
      by - By field
      bz - Bz field
      s - spin
      returnSuccessStatus - return the success status (success is when manual search is not performed). Used to monitor how many times a manual calculation is performed. The value is not actually used, this is only to overload the function.
      prevBIndices - see findInTable(double, double, double, int[][])
      Returns:
      Interpolated value from this table

    • getValue

      public double getValue​(double bx, double by, double bz, double s, int[][] prevBIndices)
      See Also:
      getValue(double, double, double, double, boolean, int[][])

    • getValue

      public double getValue​(double bx, double by, double bz, double s, int[][] prevBIndices, double frac, boolean smoothHomotopy)
      get value from this table (by interpolation) for some mix of up and down used for some of the self-consistent calculation methods.
      Parameters:
      bx - Bx field
      by - By field
      bz - Bz field
      s - spin
      prevBIndices - see findInTable(double, double, double, int[][])
      frac - at what fraction to mix the current spin state with the opposite spin state
      smoothHomotopy - whether to mix the spin states in a smooth way, such that the magnetic moment of "up" becomes that of "down" with no singularities, or naively as a weighted average
      See Also:
      getValue(double, double, double, double, boolean, int[][])

    • getValue

      public double getValue​(double bx, double by, double bz, double s)
      See Also:
      getValue(double, double, double, double, boolean, int[][])

      See Also:
      getValue(double, double, double, double, boolean, int[][])
